column4: Does anyone here know how i can create an installer usb stick from ubuntu-12.04.1-server-i386.iso?
what files were missing?
ActionParsnip these files are missing with the usb creator from the correcponding desktop verion     http://paste.ubuntu.com/1323624/
How did you get that output?
What command?
i mounted the finished new usb stick, cd into its root and executed md5sum -c md5sum.txt
it runs fine until the end part of it which is the paste in question
there are similar bugs around http://askubuntu.com/questions/127398/usb-drive-install-of-ubuntu-12-04-server-fails-cant-find-components-from-cd-r
thats why i tried to use the correspondung desktop verion of 12.04.1 but it didnt help.
Did you use an ISO or a CD when you created the USB ?
md5 checked iso
i read somewhere i could just dd the iso to the usb block device, just not sure if thats the right method for the boot loader
didnt try that yet
ActionParsnip seems like either the release iso is broken, the usb startup media creator of it or both
Try xorriso
you mean copy the files from the iso_ they arent there either
Oh, the iso is missing the files. I get it now... sorry.
Myabe you can just remaster the ISO and add them.
its the release iso for the server 12.04.1 i368 idk where to get those missing files
from desktop version
what you mean with remaster it? i dont want the desktop version, btw the desktop verion doesnt have this issue
mount the iso, add the files, create new iso from the mount.

i found the missing files in the original iso file, just copied them over to the usb stick ... now the md5sum check completes without error, i just hope those files were the ment for usb sticks, idk why they were missing ...
